quest.name: Futures Lost
journal:
 Quest Sync
Kohm Noskh gazes upon you with sorrowful eyes.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: Tiny traveler... Thou hast traversed the great expanse to stand before me. I ask thee─on thy journey, didst thou find strength?

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: None here have been spared the torment of loss...yet even tragedy cometh not in equal measure.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: Nay, of all my kin, the broodsires feel it most deeply. Eggs crushed before their eyes, hatchlings twisted beyond recognition...they cannot be blamed for turning to madness.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: One I would have you slay, for mine own power sufficeth not to end her suffering. She yet wandereth, restless, near the ash-choked lake, though naught but poison is to be found there now...

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: The lake lieth beyond the vitrified fort. End the broodmother's suffering, I beg thee...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Thou... Thou art the murderer of my children!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Long... So long have I been weary...

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: Thy countenance speaketh volumes... I thank thee.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: The metal demons struck without warning... Beautiful and pitiless as falling stars.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: We fought, yes... Yet for all our savagery, we failed to protect the young. What few survived emerged from their eggs disfigured and screaming...

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: Would that fate had taken a different course. We might have welcomed them to this world together, and guided them unto a brilliant future...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: There are still dragons on my star.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I have encountered young dragons in my travels.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: So the young have found their place elsewhere... Our kind shall live on.

dialogue.name: KOHMNOSKH
dialogue.text: I am gladdened to hear not all was in vain. May thy path lead thee true, traveler.
